value.desc: Model of the component; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'input' event) OR use v-model directive

min-height.desc: CSS unit for the minimum height of the editable area

max-height.desc: CSS unit for maximum height of the input area

height.desc: CSS value to set the height of the editable area

definitions.desc: Definition of commands and their buttons to be included in the 'toolbar' prop
examples: :definitions="{ save: { tip: 'Save your work', icon: 'save', label: 'Save', handler: saveWork }, upload: { tip: 'Upload to cloud', icon: 'cloud_upload', label: 'Upload', handler: uploadIt } }"

tip.desc: Text to be displayed as a tooltip on hover
examples: Add a contact from the Address Book

htmlTip.desc: HTML formatted text to be displayed within a tooltip on hover
examples: Add a user from the address book

key.desc: Keycode of a key to be used together with the <ctrl> key for use as a shortcut to trigger this element

handler.desc: Either this or "cmd" is required. Function for when button gets clicked/tapped.

cmd.desc: Either this or "handler" is required. This must be a valid execCommand method according to the designMode API.

param.desc: Only set a param if using a "cmd". This is commonly text or HTML to inject, but is highly dependent upon the specific cmd being called.

disable.desc: Is button disabled? If specifying a function, return a Boolean value.

type.desc: Pass the value "no-state" if the button should not have an "active" state

examples: :fonts="{ arial: 'Arial', arial_black: 'Arial Black', comic_sans: 'Comic Sans MS' }"

toolbar.desc: An array of arrays of Objects/Strings that you use to define the construction of the elements and commands available in the toolbar

toolbar-color.desc: Font color (from the Quasar Palette) of buttons and text in the toolbar

toolbar-text-color.desc: Text color (from the Quasar Palette) of toolbar commands

toolbar-toggle-color.desc: Choose the active color (from the Quasar Palette) of toolbar commands button

toolbar-push.desc: Toolbar buttons are rendered as a "push-button" type

content-style.desc: Object with CSS properties and values for styling the container of QEditor

content-class.desc: CSS classes for the input area

value.desc: The pure HTML of the content

runCmd.desc: Run contentEditable command at caret position and range

cmd.desc: Must be a valid execCommand method according to the designMode API

param.desc: The argument to pass to the command

refreshToolbar.desc: Hide the link editor if visible and force the instance to re-render

focus.desc: Focus on the contentEditable at saved cursor position

getContentEl.desc: Retrieve the content of the Editor

returns.desc: Provides the pure HTML within the editable area
